text: A watchtower is a type of fortification. Watchtower or Watch Tower may also refer to: ==Buildings and structures== * Observation tower, a stand-alone structure used to view events from a long distance and to create a full 360 degree range of vision * Lookout tower, a tower usually located at a high vantage point see any trace of fire and call for fire suppression * Watchtower (agricultural), a hut used in the ancient Middle East for watching over farmland and storing harvested produce ==Places== * Watchtower, New York, a census-designated place, United States * Watch Tower (mountain), a mountain in the Wind River Range, Wyoming, U.S. * The Watchtower (Alberta), a mountain summit in the Canadian Rockies ==Religion== * The Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society of Pennsylvania, a publishing company of Jehovah's Witnesses ** The Watchtower, a magazine published by Jehovah's Witnesses *Watchtower movement, a religious and political movement in the Democratic Republic of the Congo *Watchtower (magic), a type of guardian spirit ==Military== * Guadalcanal Campaign, codenamed Operation Watchtower, a military campaign fought between 7 August 1942 and 9 February 1943 ==Arts and entertainment== * Watchtower (2001 film) * The Watch Tower, a 1966 novel by Elizabeth Harrower * Watchtower (novel), a 1979 novel in the Chronicles of Tornor series * Justice League Watchtower, the name of various headquarters of the fictional superhero team "Justice League" * Watchtower, the codename of the character Chloe Sullivan in the TV series Smallville * Watchtower (band), a progressive metal band ===Songs=== *"Watchtower" (song), a 2012 song by Devlin *"Watchtower", a 1989 song by The Psychedelic Furs *"Watchtower", a 1997 song by Echo & the Bunnymen on "Nothing Lasts Forever" *"Watchtower", a 2007 song by Abigail Williams on Legend
